name: Payment
description:
The attestation type is used to prove that a native currency payment was carried out on some blockchain.
 Various blockchains support different types of native payments. For each block chain, it is specified how a payment
 transaction should be formed to be provable by this attestation type.
 The provable payments emulate usual banking payment from entity A to entity B in native currency with an optional payment reference.
verification:
Based on transaction id, the transaction is fetched from the API of the blockchain node or relevant indexer.
 If the transaction cannot be fetched or the transaction is in a block that does not have sufficient [number of confirmations](/specs/attestations/configs.md#finalityconfirmation), the attestation request is rejected.
 Once the transaction is received, the [payment summary](/specs/attestations/external-chains/transactions.md#payment-summary) is computed according to the source chain.
 If summary is successfully calculated, the response is assembled from the summary.
 Otherwise, the attestation request is rejected.

params.comment: Number of the block in which the transaction is included.

params.comment: The timestamps of the block in which the transaction is included.

params.name: sourceAddressHash
params.comment: Standard address hash of the source address.

params.name: receivingAddressHash
params.comment: Standard address hash of the receiving address. Zero 32-byte string if there is no receivingAddress (if `status` is not success).

params.name: intendedReceivingAddressHash
params.comment: Standard address hash of the intended receiving address. Relevant if the transaction was unsuccessful.

params.name: spentAmount
params.comment: Amount spent by the source address.

params.name: intendedSpentAmount
params.comment: Amount to be spent by the source address. Relevant if the transaction status is not success.

params.name: receivedAmount
params.comment: Amount received by the receiving address.

params.name: intendedReceivedAmount
params.comment: Amount intended to be received by the receiving address. Relevant if the transaction was unsuccessful.

params.name: standardPaymentReference
params.comment: Identifier of the transaction as defined [here](/specs/attestations/external-chains/standardPaymentReference.md).

params.name: oneToOne
params.comment: Indicator whether only one source and one receiver are involved in the transaction.
